question.body: Which of the following is part of the gastrointestinal tract, rather than an accessory digestive organ?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This organ produces bile that empties into GI tract through duct.
Incorrect. This organ stores bile that empties into GI tract through duct.
Incorrect. This organ produces pancreatic juice that empties into GI tract through duct.
Correct. Portions of this are shared between the digestive and respiratory systems.

part.hint: The main difference is that all of the GI tract has food in some stage of digestion passing through it; while accessory digestive organ ducts pass substances into the GI tract but donâ€™t have food passing through them.
